contentrichtext.text: {{Nofootnotes|date=January 2008}} '''Mary Dorothy Christian''' nÃ©e Perry (June 12, 1889 – April 20, 2003) was an [[United States|American]] [[supercentenarian]] who became the [[oldest people|oldest recognized person in the United States]] at age 113 upon the death of 113-year-old [[Mae Harrington]] and was succeeded in this title by another 113-year-old, [[Elena Slough]]. Perry was born in [[Taunton, Massachusetts]] to parents whose name had been [[anglicism|anglicized]] from ''Perreira'' (she was of [[Portugal|Portuguese]] descent). She spent much of her life in [[California]], where she died in a [[San Pablo, California]] nursing home at [[list of the oldest people|113 years and 312 days]]. ==See also== * [[List of the oldest people]] * [[Oldest people]] * [[Supercentenarian]] ==References== * [http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2003/04/22/national/main550622.shtml CBS News - Nation's oldest person dies at age 113] *{{cite news |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2002/11/08/BA245357.DTL |title=113-year-old is oldest American |work=San Francisco Chronicle |author=Charles Burress |date=November 8, 2002 |accessdate=2007-12-10}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Christian, Mary | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = June 12, 1889 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = April 20, 2003 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Christian, Mary}} [[Category:1889 births]] [[Category:2003 deaths]] [[Category:Verified American supercentenarians]] {{US-bio-stub}} [[it:Supercentenari statunitensi#Decani degli Stati Uniti]]
